result.execSummary:
The defendant Sean J. Jacobson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Resisting/Failing to Stop/Fleeing [Modifiers: Penalty - Resisting/Failing to Stop/Fleeing], an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 346.04(2t).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: --pay costs of $243 + $200 DNA Surcharge = $443; APPLY CASH BOND & RETURN REMAINDER TO SURETY

--serve 30 days in Jefferson County Jail, with Huber/Work-Release privileges; to commence 10/24/14 by 7:00 pm 

--Defendant is required to report for commencement and service of jail sentence with absolute sobriety and without controlled substances in system; non-compliance will result in loss of Huber privileges without further process.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Sean J. Jacobson

defendant.name: Jacobson, Sean J.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Case called at 2:07 pm [Clerk SH]
[Reserve Judge Robert Mawdsley presiding for BrIV]
Defendant Sean J. Jacobson in court with Attorney Michael C. Witt. DA Susan V. Happ appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
On Motion of the State, the Court amends Count #1 to Resisting a Traffic Officer by Failing to Stop, contrary to 346.04(2t) & 346.17(2t), a misdemeanor

Constitutional rights given; plea of "Guilty" entered; factual basis stipulated; victim rights compliance verified; Court finds the plea has been entered freely, voluntarily, intelligently and accepts the plea, finds Defendant guilty, orders JOC entered.

Court sentences Defendant to:
--serve 30 days in Jefferson County Jail, with Huber/Work-Release privileges; to commence 10/24/14 by 7:00 pm 
--2 days credit for time already served given
--Defendant is required to report for commencement and service of jail sentence with absolute sobriety and without controlled substances in system; non-compliance will result in loss of Huber privileges without further process.
--pay costs of $243 + $200 DNA Surcharge = $443; APPLY CASH BOND & RETURN REMAINDER TO SURETY
Recess: 2:20 pm
Status conference on October 10, 2014 at 02:00 pm.

Case 14CF288 & 14TR5646 called together at 2:07 pm [Clerk SH]
[Reserve Judge Robert Mawdsley presiding for BrIV]
Defendant Sean J. Jacobson in court with Attorney Michael C. Witt. DA Susan V. Happ appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Witt: Would like felony matter set for plea/sentencing, presents basis and submits disposition stipulation 

Defendant enters Guilty plea to 14TR5650, Court adopts disposition stipulation
Court dismisses 14TR5651 & 14TR5646 & does not revoke drivers license until 6:00 pm 9/19/14
Court orders exemption of interlock on 1999 Pontiac and all owned motorcycles
2009 Dodge Avenger will be subject to IID order

NEXT: 14CF288: (1) Schedule STC (Possible Plea/Sentencing) 10/10/14 at 2:00 pm - Send notices
Defendant's Response to State's Demand for Discovery
General Objection to the Use of Hearsay at Preliminary Hearing
Status conference on September 19, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
Pre-trial conference on September 10, 2014 at 03:20 pm.
Scheduling Notice; Your Right to Legal Representation in a Criminal or Criminal Traffic Case

[Clerk: MK]
case called at 1:39pm. 
Defendant Sean J. Jacobson appears via videoconferencing from the Jefferson County Jail, in custody, with Attorney Jeffrey De La Rosa (PD appears for bond purposes only; Mr. Jacobson declined to have a review done for eligibility determination).  ADA Jeffrey Shock appears for the State of Wisconsin.  
Mr. Jacobson verifies that the date of birth and address listed on the Criminal Complaint is accurate.

The Court discloses that in the Court's former capacity as Jefferson County District Attorney, then- DA Wambach did prosecute Mr. Jacobson. The Court does not have any recollection of Mr. Jacobson or the case; the Court does not feel that any disqualification or recusal is needed.

Service of Complaint admitted, reading waived, the charge and maximum penalties are recited. 
The Court finds probable cause to exist in the Criminal Complaint. 
Preliminary Hearing time limits are waived by both parties.

The Court requires a $500 cash bond, with conditions:
--no possession or consumption of alcohol
--no presence in bars, taverns, liquor stores
--not to drive any vehicle unless validly licensed to do so

Right to counsel given; constructive waiver of counsel warnings given.
On agreement of counsel, the Court finds that the videoconferencing system is sight and sound sufficient. 
recess 1:51pm. 

NEXT: (1) Pretrial Conference on 9/10/14 at 3:20pm (2) Status Conference on 9/19 at 1:30pm. (JA- please note in comments that case is still at Prelim stage)
